elements.name: identifier
elements.label: Identifier
elements.toolTip: Input a 3 character identifier for the resource group and resource names created with this solution. The identifier should represent a unique value within your organization, such as a business unit or project.

constraints.validationMessage: The value must be 1 - 3 characters in length and must be alphanumeric.

elements.name: environment
elements.label: Environment
elements.toolTip: Select the target environment for the solution: Development (d), Test (t), Production (p). The abbreviation will be used as part of the naming convention for the resoure groups and resources.

elements.name: stampIndex
elements.label: Stamp Index
elements.toolTip: The stamp index allows for multiple AVD stamps with the same business unit or project to support different use cases. For example, '0' could be used for an office workers host pool and '1' could be used for a developers host pool.

elements.name: location
elements.label: Location
elements.toolTip: Select the location for the AVD management resources: host pool, workspace, application group, etc.

elements.name: validation
elements.label: Validation Environment
elements.toolTip: Choose whether to deploy the host pool as a validation environment. This allows you test preview features for AVD before they are released to production.

elements.name: loadBalancerAlgorithm
elements.label: Load Balancing Algorithm
elements.toolTip: Breadth-first load balancing distributes new user sessions across all available session hosts in the host pool. Depth-first load balancing distributes new user sessions to an available session host with the highest number of connections but has not reached its maximum session limit threshold.

allowedValues.label: BreadthFirst
allowedValues.description: Each new session is placed on the next VM. (Performance Optimized)

allowedValues.label: DepthFirst
allowedValues.description: Each new session is placed on the same VM until max sessions limit. (Cost Optimized)

elements.name: maxSessions
elements.label: Max Session Limit
elements.toolTip: The maximum number of users that have concurrent sessions on a session host. When setting a host pool to have depth first load balancing or planning to use Autoscaling, you must set an appropriate max session limit according to the configuration of your deployment and capacity of your VMs.

elements.name: assignmentType
elements.label: Assignment Type
elements.toolTip:
Automatic assignment - The service will select an available host and assign it to an user.
Direct assignment - Admin selects a specific host to assign to an user.

allowedValues.label: Automatic (Recommended)
allowedValues.description: Users are assigned an available VM the first time they connect.

allowedValues.label: Direct
allowedValues.description: An administrator assigns a VM for each individual user.

elements.name: location
elements.label: Location
elements.toolTip: Select the location for the AVD session host resources: virtual machines, disks, network interfaces, etc.

elements.name: availability
elements.label: Availability Options
elements.toolTip: Select the redundancy / resiliency for the virtual machines.

elements.name: count
elements.label: Count
elements.toolTip: Select the number of virtual machines needed to expedite your data migration.

elements.name: size
elements.label: Virtual Machine Size
elements.toolTip: Select the size of the virtual machines. Multi-session hosts should have 4 - 24 vCPUs. Single session host should have 2 or more vCPUs.

elements.name: diskSku
elements.label: OS Disk SKU
elements.toolTip: Select the disk SKU for the operating system disk.

elements.name: diskEncryption
elements.label: Disk Encryption
elements.toolTip: Enables disk encryption using the recommended zero trust configuration on the management VM and session hosts disks. This setting disables network access to the disks, enables encryption at host, and server side encryption with double encryption (PMK + CMK).

elements.name: drainMode
elements.label: Drain Mode
elements.toolTip: Enables drain mode on the AVD session hosts so the virtual machines cannot be accessed until they have been validated.

elements.name: source
elements.label: Image Source
elements.toolTip: Select the type of image to deploy on the session hosts.

elements.name: offer
elements.label: Offer
elements.toolTip: Select the desired marketplace image offer.

elements.name: sku
elements.label: SKU
elements.toolTip: Select the desired marketplace image SKU.

elements.name: type
elements.label: Type
elements.toolTip: Choose a type of security that matches your needs: Standard includes basic protections at no additional cost. Trusted launch virtual machines provide additional security features on Gen2 virtual machines to protect against persistent and advanced attacks.

elements.name: secureBoot
elements.label: Enable secure boot
elements.toolTip: Secure boot helps protect your VMs against boot kits, rootkits, and kernel-level malware.

elements.name: vTpm
elements.label: Enable vTPM
elements.toolTip: Virtual Trusted Platform Module (vTPM) is TPM2.0 compliant and validates your VM boot integrity apart from securely storing keys and secrets.

elements.name: subnet
elements.label: Subnet
elements.toolTip: Select an existing subnet for the AVD session hosts.

elements.name: solution
elements.label: Active Directory Solution
elements.toolTip: Choose the Active Directory solution that already exists.

elements.name: intune
elements.label: Intune Enrollment
elements.toolTip: If Intune is configured in your Azure AD tenant, you can choose to have the VM automatically enrolled during the deployment by selecting Yes.

elements.name: domainName
elements.label: Domain Name
elements.toolTip: Provide domain name for the selected Active Directory solution.

elements.name: ouPath
elements.label: OU Path
elements.toolTip: Input the distinguished name of the desired organization unit for the AVD session hosts. If a value is not provided, the session hosts will be placed in the default organizational unit.

elements.name: userPrincipalName
elements.label: User Principal Name
elements.toolTip: Enter the user principal name with domain join privileges.

constraints.validationMessage: The value must be a valid user principal name.

elements.name: password
elements.toolTip: Enter a password that is alphanumeric, contains at least 12 characters, 1 letter, 1 number and 1 special character.

elements.name: username
elements.label: Username
elements.toolTip: Input the username for the local administrator account.

elements.name: password
elements.toolTip: Input the password for the local administrator account.

constraints.validationMessage: The value must be within 12 to 123 characters, be alphanumeric, and include 1 lower case character, 1 upper case character, 1 number, and 1 special character that is not '\' or '-'.

elements.name: profileSolution
elements.label: Profile Solution
elements.toolTip: Select the user profile solution for your end users.

elements.name: storageProduct
elements.label: Storage Product
elements.toolTip: Select the storage product for the FSLogix profiles.

elements.name: storageSku
elements.label: Storage SKU
elements.toolTip: Select the storage SKU for the FSLogix profiles.

elements.name: storageEndpoint
elements.label: Storage Endpoint
elements.toolTip: Select the storage endpoint for the FSLogix profiles.

elements.name: storageKerberosEncryption
elements.label: Storage Kerberos Encryption
elements.toolTip: Select the storage endpoint for the FSLogix profiles.

elements.name: storageCount
elements.label: Storage Count
elements.toolTip: The stamp index allows for multiple AVD stamps with the same business unit or project to support different use cases. For example, '0' could be used for an office workers host pool and '1' could be used for a developers host pool.

elements.name: storageShareSize
elements.label: Storage Share Size (GB)
elements.toolTip: The stamp index allows for multiple AVD stamps with the same business unit or project to support different use cases. For example, '0' could be used for an office workers host pool and '1' could be used for a developers host pool.

elements.name: fslogixSolution
elements.label: FSLogix Solution
elements.toolTip: Select the solution for the FSLogix profiles.

elements.name: beginPeakTime
elements.label: Begin Peak Time
elements.toolTip: Input the time when peak hours begin for your end users.

validations.message: The value must be in a proper time format with a two digit hour and two digit minutes, e.g. 12am should be input as 00:00.

elements.name: endPeakTime
elements.label: End Peak Time
elements.toolTip: Input the time when peak hours end for your end users.

validations.message: The value must be in a proper time format with a two digit hour and two digit minutes, e.g. 8pm should be input as 20:00.

elements.name: forceLogOff
elements.label: Force Log Off (Seconds)
elements.toolTip: Use this setting to force logoff users if session time limit settings cannot be used.

validations.message: The value must be between 1 and 3 digits.

elements.name: minimumHosts
elements.label: Minimum Number of Session Hosts
elements.toolTip: Use this setting to determine the minimum number of sessions hosts to keep online.

validations.message: The value must be between 1 and 4 digits.

elements.name: cpuThreshold
elements.label: Session Threshold Per CPU
elements.toolTip: Use this setting to determine the number of sessions per CPU before turning on another host.

validations.message: The value must be a number with 1 whole number and, if desired, a single or two digit decimal number.
